item.title: WWII Veteran Tom Rice on D-Day and Combat
item.description: WWII veteran Tom Rice, who fought 336 days across major battles and was wounded four times, recounts setting up a D-Day trap and his experiences from Normandy to Hitler’s Eagle’s Nest.

item.title: I Didn’t Realize the Bullet Hit Both Legs
item.description: A harrowing firsthand account of being shot, detailing the shock and challenges of surviving a bullet that passed through both legs during combat.

item.title: We Could Hear the Japanese Talking
item.description: A WWII veteran recalls an intense moment of combat, describing how close they were to enemy forces and the tension of hearing Japanese soldiers speak nearby.

item.title: The Real ‘Masters of the Air’
item.description: Exploring the true stories behind the “Masters of the Air,” highlighting the bravery, skill, and experiences of the airmen who shaped aerial combat history.

item.title: Gene Simmons Shares the Gift He Gave His Mom
item.description: Legendary rocker Gene Simmons reveals the special gift he gave his mother after KISS rose to fame, sharing a personal and heartfelt story from his journey to stardom.

item.title: I Peeked Over the Top and Saw the Muzzle Flash
item.description: A firsthand account of a combat moment, describing the intensity and danger of seeing a muzzle flash while peeking over cover during a firefight.

item.title: First Wave of Marines at Iwo Jima
item.description: A look at the first wave of Marines who landed on Iwo Jima, highlighting their courage, challenges faced, and the historic significance of this pivotal WWII battle.

item.title: Darrell Utt: Green Beret, Ranger, Sniper
item.description: Darrell Utt joined the Army in 1990, became a Green Beret, Ranger, and sniper, served in the Balkans, and led an elite special forces detachment in the Iraq War after 9/11.

item.title: Sealing Caves & Facing Shadows: WWII Marine Story
item.description: A WWII Marine recounts sealing enemy caves and confronting hidden dangers, sharing firsthand experiences of courage, strategy, and survival in intense combat.

item.title: "This Country Must Not Fail" – My Father’s Words
item.description: A poignant reflection on a father’s words before going to war, capturing his sense of duty, patriotism, and the personal impact of his service.

item.title: My Captors Told Me I Was Dying
item.description: A harrowing firsthand account of captivity, recounting the psychological pressure, fear, and resilience required to survive when captors said death was imminent.

item.title: WWII Veteran Russell Sattazahn Survives 88mm Hit
item.description: WWII veteran Russell Sattazahn took shelter in a German house that was hit by a German 88. He lost his right hand and suffered facial shrapnel wounds, surviving a devastating blast.

item.title: Clarence Singleton: Vietnam Marine Story
item.description: Clarence Singleton joined the Marines in 1967, served in Vietnam during the Tet Offensive, was seriously wounded in a rocket attack, and later medically discharged.

item.title: Tragic Incident: Shot and Killed Instantly
item.description: A sudden and fatal shooting is recounted, detailing the circumstances and impact of an immediate and tragic loss.

item.title: We Had No Idea the Camps Existed
item.description: A surprising discovery of hidden camps during an exploration, revealing unexpected locations and uncovering stories previously unknown.

item.title: A Shocking Thought He Never Expected
item.description: An intense moment of raw emotion is shared, reflecting anger and stress during a difficult experience, and how those feelings were confronted and processed safely.

item.title: Colorblindness Led Him to the U.S. Army
item.description: A story of how his colorblindness unexpectedly guided him into the U.S. Army, highlighting unique challenges, experiences, and opportunities in military service.

item.title: Witnessing Massive Death and Destruction
item.description: A firsthand account of overwhelming destruction and loss, capturing the scale, impact, and emotional weight of a devastating event.

item.title: Ramp Dropped, Machine Guns Open Fire
item.description: A veteran recounts the intense moment when the ramp dropped and enemy machine guns unleashed fire. A firsthand account of combat danger and chaos.
